headline: What United Rentals (URI)'s $2 Billion Buyback and Upbeat Outlook Mean for Shareholders
summary: In the past week, United Rentals reported record third-quarter 2025 revenues and adjusted EBITDA, supported by strong construction and industrial market demand, and announced the launch of a US$2 billion share buyback program following the completion of its earlier US$1.5 billion repurchase plan. Despite falling short of earnings per share expectations, management raised the company’s full-year outlook, highlighting confidence in ongoing large project growth and solid specialty segment...
